New Records: The Thunder tied the longest winning streak in franchise history, which was set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander spearheaded the Thunder with 33 points, seven assists, four rebounds, a steal and a block.
Aaron Wiggins made shots when it mattered the most, scoring 15 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter.
The Thunder unleashed a 12-3 run capped by an Isaiah Joe 3-pointer to grab a one-point lead, 92-91, with 8:15 remaining.
Aaron Wiggins and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander teamed up to wrest total control of the game, 108-101, with 2:21 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder rose to 29-5 in the season, while the Knicks dropped to 24-11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This tied the longest winning streak in franchise history, which was set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
LeBron James surpassed Michael Jordan for the most 30-point games in NBA history.
Others: Isaiah Hartenstein and Lu Dort iced the game.
Derrick White finished with 23 points and four rebounds for the Celtics.
Victor Wembanyama had 35 points and 18 rebounds with four assists for the Spurs.
Evan Mobley had a 34 point-10 rebound performance for the Cavaliers.
